vision.notes: Zooids have reduced morphology, but the extent of visual capabilities across the family is unknown.

chemoreception.notes: As marine invertebrates, they likely rely on chemoreception for feeding and habitat selection. Inferred from general knowledge of tunicates.

mechanoreception.notes: Likely used to detect water currents and physical contact. Inferred from their sessile, colonial lifestyle.

photosymbiosis_related_light_detection.notes: Obligate photosymbiotic relationships with cyanobacteria (Prochloron) suggest a general ability to detect and respond to light levels, though this might be specific to the symbiotic relationship rather than a general visual sense.
